Power and Associates. Based on interviews…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/big-box-shoppers-more-likely-to-buy-unlocked-phones-switch-carriers-j-d-power-says/71001/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>“Strategic value” in supporting startups, MasterCard says</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/strategic-value-in-supporting-startups-mastercard-says/70971</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/strategic-value-in-supporting-startups-mastercard-says/70971#respond</comments> <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:30:34 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Emin Wood]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Leadership]]></category> <category><![CDATA[mastercard]]></category> <category><![CDATA[nymi]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Ryerson DMZ]]></category> <category><![CDATA[startup]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70971</guid> <description><![CDATA[Two years after adding Toronto-based wearables firm Nymi to its first list of supported companies, MasterCard Inc.’s Start Path program returned to Ontario’s capital yesterday, inviting startups from around the world to showcase their products and services for both MasterCard and partners such as the Royal Bank of Canada (RBC). In all, 13 new and…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/strategic-value-in-supporting-startups-mastercard-says/70971/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>What does consent look like in the 21st century? Facebook is beginning to roll out a new feature in its Messenger app – chat bots. The feature allows companies to interact with consumers on a very personal (yet automated) level, something businesses may consider using as…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/5-potential-pitfalls-of-facebook-messengers-new-chat-bot-feature/70644/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>How shoe retailer Aldo digitized its retail efforts with SAP Hybris</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/how-shoe-retailer-aldo-digitized-its-retail-efforts-with-sap-hybris/70628</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/how-shoe-retailer-aldo-digitized-its-retail-efforts-with-sap-hybris/70628#respond</comments> <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 17:21:10 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Emin Wood]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Cloud]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Service]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Accenture]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Aldo]]></category> <category><![CDATA[retail]]></category> <category><![CDATA[SAP Hybris]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70628</guid> <description><![CDATA[It might be an icon in the world of footwear, but until recently Montreal-based Aldo Group didn’t have much of a digital footprint: by the company’s own admission, its previous iCongo servers were difficult to update, and frequently plagued by inventory inaccuracy and poor performance during moments of high website traffic. That changed in September…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/how-shoe-retailer-aldo-digitized-its-retail-efforts-with-sap-hybris/70628/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>Apple Pay expands in Canada with support from major banks for debit and credit cards</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/apple-pay-arrives-in-canada-with-support-from-interac-and-mastercard/70815</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/apple-pay-arrives-in-canada-with-support-from-interac-and-mastercard/70815#comments</comments> <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 13:58:44 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Brian Jackson]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Finance]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Mobility]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Apple Pay]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Interac]]></category> <category><![CDATA[iPhone 6s]]></category> <category><![CDATA[mastercard]]></category> <category><![CDATA[visa]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70815</guid> <description><![CDATA[Millions more Canadians could finally have access to Apple Pay, with the Cupertino, Calif. tech giant announcing today that the big five national banks, and payment networks Interac, Visa, and MasterCard have all pledged to support the mobile payment system. Until yesterday, Apple Pay was available in Canada only to American Express cardholders, not including those…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/apple-pay-arrives-in-canada-with-support-from-interac-and-mastercard/70815/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>2</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>Mississauga’s SOTI helps McDonald’s UK roll out new tablet-based menus</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/mississaugas-soti-helps-mcdonalds-uk-roll-out-new-tablet-based-menus/70763</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/mississaugas-soti-helps-mcdonalds-uk-roll-out-new-tablet-based-menus/70763#respond</comments> <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 21:06:20 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Emin Wood]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Service]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Technology]]></category> <category><![CDATA[McDonalds]]></category> <category><![CDATA[soti]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70763</guid> <description><![CDATA[At approximately 100 McDonald’s restaurants across the U.K., the customers who walk in can order their meals on a touchscreen, charge their phones at their tables, and use tablets provided by the restaurant to play games, surf the Internet, or check email while they eat. The touchscreens and tablets are part of “Experience of the…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/mississaugas-soti-helps-mcdonalds-uk-roll-out-new-tablet-based-menus/70763/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>Climbing to $20 B revenue, Air Canada takes to the cloud with Salesforce</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/climbing-to-20-b-revenue-air-canada-takes-to-the-cloud-with-salesforce/70765</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/climbing-to-20-b-revenue-air-canada-takes-to-the-cloud-with-salesforce/70765#respond</comments> <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 20:40:16 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Brian Jackson]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Cloud]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Posts]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Sales and Marketing]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Air Canada]]></category> <category><![CDATA[CRM]]></category> <category><![CDATA[salesforce]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70765</guid> <description><![CDATA[You can’t grow to be a $20 billion business if you’re not paying attention to your customer’s contract renewals until after the fact. For the airline’s business-to-business sales, too often…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/climbing-to-20-b-revenue-air-canada-takes-to-the-cloud-with-salesforce/70765/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>What can you advertise in 3 seconds? Ask Under Armour and Stephen Curry</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/what-can-you-advertise-in-3-seconds-ask-under-armour-and-stephen-curry/70521</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/what-can-you-advertise-in-3-seconds-ask-under-armour-and-stephen-curry/70521#comments</comments> <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 18:23:07 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Jackie Atkins]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Sales and Marketing]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Sports Tech]]></category> <category><![CDATA[basketball]]></category> <category><![CDATA[marketing]]></category> <category><![CDATA[social media]]></category> <category><![CDATA[twitter]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70521</guid> <description><![CDATA[With the NBA playoffs in full swing, Under Armour is looking to capitalize on Stephen Curry’s uncanny ability to shoot from the three-point line. Every time the Golden State Warrior’s point guard shoots a three-pointer, Under Armour will air a new three-second ad featuring the star on their basketball-specific Twitter feed. The concept started to take…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/what-can-you-advertise-in-3-seconds-ask-under-armour-and-stephen-curry/70521/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>1</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>Thanks to PayPal, your customers can now return online purchases for free</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/thanks-to-paypal-you-can-now-return-online-purchases-for-free/70726</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/thanks-to-paypal-you-can-now-return-online-purchases-for-free/70726#respond</comments> <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 15:26:59 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Emin Wood]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Finance]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Service]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Ipsos]]></category> <category><![CDATA[online shopping]]></category> <category><![CDATA[PayPal]]></category> <category><![CDATA[PayPal Canada]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70726</guid> <description><![CDATA[If you’ve ever had a customer complain that the product they ordered online didn’t match what they received, PayPal Holdings, Inc. would like to help you out. The e-commerce giant officially launched its “Return Shipping on Us” service in Canada today, allowing Canadian PayPal users who are unsatisfied with their online purchases to receive shipping…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/thanks-to-paypal-you-can-now-return-online-purchases-for-free/70726/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>Top business smartphones for 2016: Samsung Galaxy S7 review</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/top-business-smartphones-for-2016-samsung-galaxy-s7-review/70590</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/top-business-smartphones-for-2016-samsung-galaxy-s7-review/70590#respond</comments> <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 13:28:57 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Alex Davies]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Mobility]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Technology]]></category> <category><![CDATA[android]]></category> <category><![CDATA[business]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Galaxy S7]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Google]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Knox]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Mobile]]></category> <category><![CDATA[mobile devices]]></category> <category><![CDATA[mobility]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Samsung]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Samsung Knox]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Security]]></category> <category><![CDATA[smartphone]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Smartphones]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70590</guid> <description><![CDATA[Last year when we looked at Samsung’s 2015 flagship phone, the Galaxy S6, we called it a “smartphone magnum opus.” After years of making good, but not great, phones, Samsung stepped up to the plate and delivered a glass and metal masterpiece. How are they going to top that in 2016? Well, at first glance,…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/top-business-smartphones-for-2016-samsung-galaxy-s7-review/70590/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>3 benefits of applying Google Analytics to your AdWords efforts</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/3-benefits-of-applying-google-analytics-to-your-adwords-efforts/70673</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/3-benefits-of-applying-google-analytics-to-your-adwords-efforts/70673#respond</comments> <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 22:04:40 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Emin Wood]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Sales and Marketing]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Tutorials]]></category> <category><![CDATA[AdWords]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Google]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Google Adwords]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Google Analytics]]></category> <category><![CDATA[search engine marketing]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70673</guid> <description><![CDATA[Many companies simply use Google Analytics as a tool for measuring traffic on their websites – but as illustrated by Sean Quadlin, Google Inc.’s search engine marketing (SEM) best practices marketing manager, it can also augment their efforts to increase said traffic. In the video below, Quadlin shares three ways you can apply Analytics data…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/3-benefits-of-applying-google-analytics-to-your-adwords-efforts/70673/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>Think today’s Canadians only want digital service? Not so fast [infographic]</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/think-todays-canadians-only-want-digital-service-not-so-fast-infographic/70588</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/think-todays-canadians-only-want-digital-service-not-so-fast-infographic/70588#respond</comments> <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 20:38:58 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Emin Wood]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Service]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Accenture]]></category> <category><![CDATA[digital marketing]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70588</guid> <description><![CDATA[That retailers of the future will need to reach their customers through digital means has been a drumbeat for so long it nearly lies at the heart of today’s industry, but a new report by multinational consultation firm Accenture PLC reminds business owners that when it comes to customer service, they need to remember the…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/think-todays-canadians-only-want-digital-service-not-so-fast-infographic/70588/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>Free Windows 10 upgrade offer to expire this summer</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/free-windows-10-upgrade-offer-to-expire-this-summer/70626</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/free-windows-10-upgrade-offer-to-expire-this-summer/70626#respond</comments> <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 19:36:45 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Emin Wood]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Operations]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Tutorials]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Microsoft]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Windows 10]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70626</guid> <description><![CDATA[Microsoft Corp. announced that Windows users have just under three months to upgrade their devices to Windows 10 for free. As of July 29, 2016 – the program’s one-year anniversary – the company will begin charging $119 USD. “The free upgrade offer to Windows 10 was a first for Microsoft, helping people upgrade faster than ever before,”…]]></description> <wfw:commentRss>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/free-windows-10-upgrade-offer-to-expire-this-summer/70626/feed</wfw:commentRss> <slash:comments>0</slash:comments> </item> <item><title>IDC: Canadian business models must shift to reap IoT rewards</title><link>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/idc-canadian-business-models-must-shift-to-reap-iot-rewards/70148</link> <comments>http://www.itbusiness.ca/news/idc-canadian-business-models-must-shift-to-reap-iot-rewards/70148#respond</comments> <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 13:42:22 +0000</pubDate> <dc:creator><![CDATA[Christine Wong]]></dc:creator> <category><![CDATA[Mobility]]></category> <category><![CDATA[IDC Canada]]></category> <category><![CDATA[Internet of Things]]></category><guid>http://www.itbusiness.ca?p=70148</guid> <description><![CDATA[Canadian businesses are poised for wider Internet of Things adoption but must reshape parts of their operations to reap the full benefits, according to IDC Canada. About 45 per cent of all SMEs in Canada have already deployed some form of non-consumer IoT device, IDC’s Nigel Wallis said Thursday during a presentation in Toronto.
